content.title: Hotter world threatens the breadbasket of the US - Financial Times
content.desc: The past summer was fecund for US farms. Yields per acre of corn, soyabeans and spring wheat are all forecast to break records. The future is less certain, however, with crop yields projected to come under pressure as global warming accelerates. Understanding when, where and how is critical to feeding the world in the decades to come. US field crop agriculture is the most productive on earth. Tens of millions of tonnes of exports make it important to the rest of the world. Farm sales of corn, soyabeans and wheat totalled almost $100bn last year, according to the US Department of Agriculture...
